review: I so love Red Robin! I've never had a bad experience there and everything I've ordered has been yummy.  They're good at refilling drinks quickly  - and don't judge me because I can down a gallon of Iced Tea :) The only reason I gave it 4 stars is because they always have balloons around and I don't like balloons.

This Red Robin was just OK. I'm used to RR being a place for delicious burgers with quick and friendly service. The food was great here but the service was a little bit "meh". I also didn't remember any other RR being as jam-packed with kids as this location. Don't get me wrong, I know its a family restaurant but there were children literally everywhere. I guess we can chalk that up to being in Fairfax. We arrived to what we were told was a 5-10 minute wait, they host and manager then proceeded to seat every single customer before us and several parties that arrived well after us. After about 15-20 minutes, my husband asked about our table and we were the next group seated. We ordered drinks and waited quite some time for them. Finally we ordered our food: I got a Whiskey River Chicken sandwich and subbed the tomato for avocado--they did this for free which was really great! My husband ordered the Bonzai burger. I also asked for a cup of soup to be served before our meal and my husband asked for his fries first because we were STARVING. Unfortunately we didn't get the soup or fries first and our orders came out about 25 minutes later. The soup was taken off our bill with no problems. The restaurant was very busy and I definitely saw our waiter running around a lot so I certainly can't say anything bad about him being "lazy" or "slow". A little more organization would have meant a higher bill and thus, a larger tip for our waiter but he was a nice guy and I didn't really mind not having my soup. Overall-- it wasn't a bad experience but it's definitely not our favorite Red Robin.
If you can get Kevin as your server - do so. Very friendly, appropriately attentive, the works! Food-wise Red Robin never misses to me. The food is consistently good.

I normally enjoy the burgers at Red Robin, but this was an exception.  I went for lunch and sat in the bar.  They were not at all busy when I arrived at 11:30.  The visit started out badly and went downhill from there.  On my last visit, the server had given me a Royal Rewards card and told me not to activate until I knew I would be back within 2 weeks as I would receive a free appetizer on my next visit.  I activated and visited today, but was refused the free appetizer.  My server told me the promotion had ended, but he would check with his manager to see if they could still honor the request.  Needless to say, the server never checked with the manager or followed up with me.  Next my lunch date ordered his burger - some sort of double patty burger with bacon.  The menu stated it came with American cheese, which he does not enjoy.  He asked for cheddar instead and the server refused because it would change the "flavor profile" of the burger!  Seriously!  Last time I checked, customers pay for food in restaurants and it should please the customer's palate, not fit the "flavor profile".   Then the last straw, the food itself.  The burgers were flavorless. I found that surprising with all the toppings on my Guacamole burger which is usually quite tasty.  My date's burgers were charred black and tiny - something akin to a fast food burger and certainly not up too what I would expect from a so-called gourmet burger chain!  I will NOT visit this location again.

Red Robin is certainly not my favorite food spot in the area, but their food is usually pretty consistent and they have a nice selection of menu items. You can eat pretty healthy on their menu or you can indulge in a greasy burger and bottomless fries.  Let's talk about the food: For the appetizers, I really like their mozzarella sticks and the onion ring tower. One of my favorite salads is the Apple Harvest Chicken Salad. The Whiskey River BBQ chicken sandwich and the Bruschetta chicken sandwiches are both delicious. I am not a big fan of the Teriyaki chicken sandwich because I actually got food poisoning from the chicken the first time I had Red Robin (over 10 years ago in Ohio). I just can't bring myself back to ordering it, but I'm sure it's fine if cooked properly.  Many of the specialty drinks are a bit too sweet for my liking, but I do enjoy the freckled lemonade if it's watered down a bit.  One thing I particularly do not like about this location is the screaming children. There are always birthday parties or large families with screaming kids. I usually try to be seated in the bar area to avoid this, but sometimes they are still seated there. As a result of all the kids, sometimes the place looks a little sloppy, with food and other junk on the floor. I will only agree to heading to Red Robin when I am in a mood to handle the loud atmosphere.

I took my boys here for their 8th birthday yesterday. The service was amazing. the food (as always) was very good. They are always very accommodating if something is not the way you like it, they fix it and are always happy to do so.

My bf and I have gone to Red Robin many times, however it was our first time to this particular one. We ordered Onion Rings which are always good. I had a chicken sandwich with broccli (Which was sub-par) My bf ordered a burger and fries. The meat had to have been spoiled, because he spent the night with loose stool and puking. DO NOT go to this Red Robin Location!

Hamburgers should not look like this: No place should be allowed to call its hamburgers "gourmet" and have them be charred into grey blandness. Had it not been for the jalapeno peppers on it, it would have tasted like nothing. Awful. Won't be back.

We've been to the Red Robin at Fair Lakes several times now. Seating is prompt. (We've had to eat in the bar area only once.) Prompt service, too, and iced tea refills. The burgers have been consistently good. On this visit, I enjoyed a Peach Iced Tea while waiting for a Bacon Cheeseburger. I like Red Robin's regualr burgers. Not too large, just right for lunch and cooked Medium as I like it. (I would like to see more regular burger varieties, but without the onion straws on top that seem to accompany the more exotic creations.) I've never tested the "bottomless" French fires. That woud be too much! But, I often will have a second helping. (Portions of the French fries seem designed with that in mind.) Sometimes the server will just bring a seocnd helping, sometiems ask if one is wanted, and sometimes you must ask. Today, our waitress asked if I would like a second helping.

We've been going to Red Robin since the late 1980s when we lived in the West. We enjoy their hamburgers. I like the Whiskey River and Peppercorn burgers. I especially like their bottomless french fries that come with the burgers - want some more fries - just ask. Occasionally we've had their onion ring appetizers, milk shakes, and mudd pie. The onion rings are full rings with a thick batter. They are good but were too much for two people. They are pretty flexible about substitutions - veggie burgers for real burgers and salad for french fries. Although we usually have (bottomless soft drinks) they do have a bar for an occasional beer. The last time we were there they had made some menu changes that we liked. Smaller versions of the selected burgers were available and smaller versions of the appetizers were available. These changes provide additional incentive to return.

I've been to this Red Robin several times and am always disappointed. The servers always seem to hate their jobs and the management isn't any better. The last time I was there was in May 2012 for my mother's birthday. She is on oxygen so you think they would put us close to the door so she doesn't have to walk across the restaurant, but no, they didn't. We had to walk across the restaurant, when clearly there was service closer to the door because other people were sitting there. The service was the worst I've ever had, to the point where I didn't even want to tip (I'm a 20-25% tipper no matter where I go). I complained to their corporate office, who then sent me an automatic e-mail saying someone from that restaurant would get back to me within 48 hours. Did that happen? Absolutely not. It took over a week to get back to me at which point the manager said, "We've been busy".  Unreal. He then said that he hopes we would give them another chance and he would be sending us something in the mail. I don't know why I actually thought something would be coming, but I did, and surprise, nothing ever came. Terrible, terrible customer service. I will never go back. I would rather drive 10 minutes down the road to the Chantilly Red Robin before I visit this one again.

Me and the wife are huge Red Robin fans, this one is a great location and has very good service.  The wife is a vegetarian and gets the Whiskey BBQ burger with the veggie patty and loves it.  I will usually get the A1 Peppercorn burger. The sauce and the burgers are very well done. I'm just a little confused, Red Robin started as a Bar in Washington near the University of Washington, and sold spirits.  Burgers came around in the 80s and proceeded to grow.  Weird at how the companies values and roots started as a drinking establishment and it's now a "family friendly" environment....

it takes forever fo your server to come - long time to bring your drinks and food, but they're quick to bring your check when you haven't even thought about any dessert yet - but you know, their dessert choices suck anyway - stay away from this Red Robin -
service was prompt; fries were cold; hamburgers were mediocre. bathrooms were disgusting. will not visit again.

Terrible service the last time I was here. Usually I am fine with Red Robin- it's not the best food, but it hits the spot if you're craving a burger and fries.  We had to wait 30 minutes for water, and 45 minutes for utensils. The server informed us that they "ran out of utensils" - WTF? The food was also cold- I ordered the popcorn shrimp, and part of it was still frozen.

Lunch was a disappointment.  I ordered the Keep It Simple burger and was not impressed.  It was dry and lacked flavor.  To the plain burger and bun, I added mayo, lettuce, tomato, red onion and pickles.  It was still dry.  So, I then drowned it in ketchup (possibly my all time favorite condiment) and it was still dry.  When I say it was dry, I mean I ordered it medium, and the color was right, but it was as dry as if I had requested well-done.  Will probably not be coming back here for a burger any time soon. The lacking in the quality of burger may be enhanced if you were to order any number of their specialty burgers, particularly if they loaded it up with lots of moist and flavorful toppings.  I'm a purist when it comes to burgers, though, and that burger better stand up on its own, in my humble opinion!! All that said, the sweet potato fries were perfection and I would go back just to pair an order of them with a beer!!  Oh, and the service was totally satisfactory.

My friend and I went there to get food to go. We went to the bar and sat down to place our order. There were two bar tenders. We sat there for 7 minutes, then got our own menus. We then sat there another 10-15 minutes before we left. No one acknowledged us or anything. We were sitting there for about 20 minutes without anyone coming to help us. We could not have been missed because there were two people sitting right next to us that got their order taken and drinks served to them. THIS WAS THE WORST SERVICE EVER!

Delicious burgers and bottomless fries! I normally get the Royal Red Robin burger with a fried egg on it.  I have never been disappointed with any of the burgers. It sometimes takes awhile to get your food even when the restaurant appears to be empty but not always.  Always a good idea to order more fries before you actually want them too because they normally take awhile to come out also.

The food here is pretty good, except for the salads. Stay away from the leafy disaster at this place! The burgers on the other hand are pretty decent and come out fairly quickly. I would go back if I was in the area...

Cleanest Red Robin I have been to. Horrible Service but the food was good. We complained about the service to the manager and he was very friendly and said he was 'ashamed' about the service as well and comped our meal. I would usually never come back after such bad service but the manager really seemed to care about our issues and I am hoping next time it will be better!

You know how they say you never want to eat where you work at?  Well, that's definitely not the case with me.  I use to work at Red Robin for a couple of years on and off through college, but I guess because I never ate here during my work shift, this doesn't really apply to me? Who knows?! Anyways! The burgers here are good and come out fairly quickly.  I use to always order the Blackened Chicken Burger, which has a peppery seasoning on the chicken and smothered in a spicy chipotle mayo mix, which was heavenly and the perfect amount of heat to a burger.  Sadly, it is no longer on the menu so now my go-to favorite is the Royal burger.  Anything topped with a fried egg is sure going to be tasty and delicious (And a heart attack).  The bottomless fries are just an added bonus (More bang for your buck!)  I love the thick cut fries, not some skinny fries that other places serve.  And the dipping sauces are great; I always get the Poppy Seed Honey Mustard and the Camp Fire BBQ.  I've only ordered those 2 burgers every time I visit, so my review is not as solid as others who have ordered more off the menu.  Not my favorite burger place, but good for a quick meal.  Service is a hit or miss sometimes, but it is pretty consistent with the delivery on their food and that's enough for me to return. However, if this review was about my experience working here... this definitely would not have the same rating...

I am really surprised by the poor reviews on what is a chain place with typical service, quality of food and selection.  I like several of the burgers (never have had one dry), but my favs are the fries and shakes.  (I've never been exceptionally good at watching calories, thank goodness for good genes!) Keep in mind most of the staff is in the 20-something crowd and don't get overly rude with them.  I listened to a small group at a table do nothing but nit-pick about every little thing as they came in, speak down to the waitress while she was taking the order and then complain that burgers were dry, fries cold, on and on and on (seriously, it was even annoying to me).  Maybe the complaints were legit, but I had a pleasant interaction with my waitress and my food was cooked perfectly and fries pipping hot.  Just sayin....

If I'm ever in the mood for a big, juicy cheeseburger or a yummy salad and don't want to travel far - this is the place to go for me! I have never had a bad experience here, but I honestly think it is all about whom your server is... and I always request the same one - Jacob Lee. Jacob is an all-star at his job. He can handle multiple tables without batting an eye or getting confused. He always has a pleasant attitude as well, even under pressure. During my last visit, he had at least 8 tables at all times and I still felt like we had his undivided attention. Like I said... he's an all-star! Whatever they're paying him at Red Robin, it probably isn't enough. During my latest visit, we ordered: raspberry tea, cherry lime flip (adult beverage), avo-cobb-o salad and an order of garlic fries. Yes, GARLIC fries... it's not on their menu, but you can ask for it and Jacob will make it happen! We also ordered the Sam Adams latest seasonal brew (pumpkin) and a garden burger with regular fries. The beverages were tasty, dropped off promptly and refilled regularly. The fries were cooked and seasoned perfectly. Although my salad was "complicated" (No blue cheese or olives and subbed shredded cheddar, with dressing on the side), everything came out exactly as I requested. The burger was also correct and tasted good (I mean, come on... it's a healthy, pre-made, veggie burger... how GREAT can it be?). But with the right toppings and Dijon sauce, Red Robin does pretty darn well with it. Throughout our dining experience Jacob came by to check on us regularly and join us in friendly conversation. Seriously, you just can't beat good service AND good food! There are just a few things to note... -When we were taken to our table by the hostess, I went to climb into the booth and the bottom portion slid out. Our hostess' response was "Oh, did it come out again? Oh, ok. Let me fix that for you" and pushed it back in. I appreciated the gesture, but the reaction was as if it was a normal, natural reaction and happens all the time. Um... time for a replacement RR!  -Lastly, and of no consequence to RR, this place is very kid-friendly. It is not uncommon for the little people to be running around or loudly talking/screaming. If you're not a kid person, this place isn't for you during "normal" meal time hours.

Honestly, this location isn't very good. I had a burger and it had no seasoning whatsoever. I started on the fries and guess what! That's where all the seasoning went! I've NEVER had to wipe the seasoning off my fries before. My burger was dry and tasteless. Even with bacon and cheddar on it. It also gave me a stomachache all day. I do not recommend this location.

I usually get the Teriyaki Burger or Chicken Sandwich, which is always a favorite.  Last time there (last week), I decided to try a Swiss Mushroom Burger that was also very juicy and tasty.  The service was pretty good - our server happened to be a "trainer" so at least you know he'd been at it for awhile.  The restaurant was clean, but there was some kind of issue with the heat.  First the heat would come pouring down on us (vent right over our heads), then change over to air conditioning!  Hot, cold, hot, cold.  I finally mentioned it to the server and he said, "Ohhh, yes, we are going to have this problem all winter long."  Something to do with sitting near the windows versus another part of the restaurant where the heat thermometer is located.  Remind me next time to NOT sit by the windows, then! Ordered a Raspberry Iced Tea and the server brought one over with another one closely followed behind.  He said he thought the first one didn't have enough raspberry syrup in it so he brought another one just in case.  Huh, a little strange since I hadn't even tasted the first one!  But okay, he was kind of right...the second one DID taste better.  I guess he knew his raspberry syrup limitations. All in all, we had a pretty good time at Red Robin.  The burger was decent, the fries are delicious (even though that "bottomless" cup they put it in fools me every time...it's truly "bottomless" and if you try to pick it up all the fries fall out), and the service was good.  A-OK!

We decided earlier in the day to go out for a nice Sunday family dinner, which is code for "my wife didn't want to cook tonight". The wife and I have both been craving burgers and Red Robin has been one of the few local burger joints we have not tried, so...off we went. First, we were greeted by the hostess (Taylor was her name) who had such charm, politeness, and a smile that just made your heart glow...like in E.T. She was so enrapturing she could of seated us outside at the back dumpster and I would have been happy. After she expertly grabbed our silverware (I'm pretty sure it wasn't REAL silver) she lead us to our table, expertly navigating through the other customers and Red Robin-ites, and  made sure we were happy with the seating arrangements, bode us a farewell with another E.T. heartglow smile and dashed back to dutifully attend to the customers who were piling in behind us for the dinner rush. Our culinary service specialist (Audrey) came to our table and immediately and cheerfully set about getting us set up with drinks (CHERRY COKES!!!...I had about eight...teen of them...which is why I am wired to the hilt right now...SUGAR AND CAFFEINE!!!) and pleasantly took our appetizer order, which was a tower of onion rings. We opted for the larger stack being that we haven't eaten much all day, which is code for "we just want to jam golden fried oniony deliciousness down our necks".  The culinary service specialist zipped off and placed our order and returned after a few moments of critical decision making on which burgers we would be partaking. While we were sitting a polite gentlemen employee (Jay/James?) brought a plate of fresh steak fries for the kids to help keep them occupied and less boisterous. Thanks Jay/James! OF NOTE: While I was looking at the menu, I noticed that one of the decorations in the restaurant was a carousel zebra perched overlooking our table...it was staring at me...it was  . It was looking at me with its large black eyeballs as if to say, "I'm a carousel zebra and this is all your fault...I'm made of wood and have a pole jammed through my midsection. Enjoy your meal!". At one point I swear it made an angry accusatory whinnying noise at me. We ordered our burgers (sirloin burger for the wife and a BBQ bacon burger for me), our 3 year old daughter got the corn dog from the kids menu with strawberries...who the hell orders a corn dog and STRAWBERRIES??? At this point an older couple and their grandson are seated in a booth adjacent to us...the kid has a robot tyrannosaurus rex. Yes, a robot T-Rex is now sitting right by me and now all I can think of is how I want a robot T-Rex too. This thing was awesome..it was remote controlled and had little tiny robot T-Rex arms and a GIANT fierce robot T-Rex head. I hope it doesn't have to reach for anything on the table with those tiny robot T-Rex arms. Awkward. The food arrives and everything is just as we ordered it, even the mayo I asked to be kept off my burger was kept off my burger. There is a special place in HELL for people that put mayo on their burgers. The burgers are cooked right and the fries are crispy...not that it matters because I just jammed half a tower of fried onion rings into my belly about 10 minutes ago. I look down at my chest and see my heartlight glowing again...but that's only because the hostess Taylor was walking by again with another set of customers. The meal was delicious and well prepared.  Dessert? Of course, because eating a 2 foot stack of onion rings, 3 plates of fries, a BBQ bacon cheeseburger, and drinking eight...teen Cherry Cokes isn't enough for us tonight! We order the Mud Pie. It was great. It was large. It was chocolate ice cream. It had whipped cream and drizzled with chocolate frosting. This is where I hit the wall. Not even the heartlight of the delightful hostess, or the angry accusatory empty black eyeballed stare of the carousel zebra, or the supreme polite culinary service specialist Audrey, or even the robot T-Rex that is tauntng me one booth over can detract from the fact that I am the biggest glutton in Fairfax tonight. I feel...shame...and a lot of pressure in my lower abdomen. We had a wonderful family meal, with great service, in a very enjoyable, clean, and presentable environment. 4/5 stars! Serious rant: I am knocking off one star due to the fact that the burger patties are mass produced frozen pre-packaged patties that have no distinct flair or flavor about them. I think that if you are going to tout "gourmet" burgers on your menu, you should be making your own burger meat with some sort of seasonings or unique flair. I have seen an overwhelming majority of restaurants use these pre-fabricated patties and it really does take away from eating a proper old fashioned burger.

Red Robin is mostly about the burgers when we come down to it. My husband and I stopped here on a Sunday on the spur of the moment after agreeing we were both hungry and we didn't know what we wanted to eat. I ordered the crispy Altantic cod sandwich and subbed the fries for a side salad. The sandwich was soaked in mayo and grease.This is not my first time getting this so I know it can be done better. My husband got the Royal Red Robin and loved it. He said the grill cooked made it just right. As soon as he bit into it the egg saturated the burger and bun making it a delicious taste bud experience. It made me very evidence as my crispy cod was no where near the experience.  One thing I thought was odd about our experience was being sat in the bar area. We were a couple that was planning to actually have a conversation instead of watching the Sunday night game. It was annoying because I kept hearing sports the whole time while trying to talk to my husband. LoL Myabe my hubby planned it this way? I guess I will never know.  Service was slow and was lacking for being a slow night at this location.

Won't ever go to this location again. The hostess seemed like she was on drugs, vaguely staring at us, and then wandering really slowly to bring us to our table. Even though there were plenty of open tables elsewhere and it was after the lunch rush, we were seated in the back right next to the kitchen door. Not a great seat. She didn't bother to say two words to us after seating us. Just walked off somewhere with a really blank look on her face. We proceeded to sit there for 10 minutes waiting for anybody to show up and say anything to us. Plenty of waiters walked by during this time, and we saw a manager walking around as well. Then we got up and walked out. Nobody noticed, and the hostess wasn't anywhere to be seen.

How can you not love a big fat burger topped with bacon and all types of delicious toppings? I come here when I want one of those types of burgers. This location is a favorite, preferred over the Chantilly location for service and food. It's kept clean from the dining area to the bathrooms. The service is always great, friendly people which is how it should be, but it seems like they definitely are trained to have excellent customer service here.  I came yesterday (4/5/14) for the first time in a couple months and they have changes their menu. It's now in a notebook style unlike the gigantic one page menu. I like this better because it's easier to look at. The chili cheese fries had a good amount of chili and bacon on top with their thick cut steal fries. The Bruschetta Chicken sandwich with pesto aioli, provolone and balsamic cream was crazy good. I usually get a burger but I wanted to try their chicken and I am surprised at how good it was. For a burger my favorite is the A1 peppercorn which has onion strings, peppercorn spread, bacon and pepperjack cheese with an onion bun. Don't even think about the calories on this one because you'd probably need to start doing cardio immediately. Chili con queso and onion tower are my favorite appetizers. As for the fries, you can't go wrong with bottomless fries especially when you asked for the garlic parmesean fries! They are free and are bottomless also!  The most important thing is to get the Red Robin loyalty card. You get rewarded and points for eating here. When you get 9 burgers, the 10th one is free. But they have $5 off, free milkshake, free birthday burger and other cool rewards, so definitely sign up.

We have been going to Red Robin for about 9 years, with our first being in Allentown, PA.  We now live in Centreville, VA and go to either the Chantilly, VA store or this on in the Fairlakes Shopping Center.  Today, apparently was not a good day to go to the Red Robin in Fairlakes.  We decided to sit in the bar, (1st, mistake)...the tables were very dirty, we asked the server to wipe our table down, 10 min. later he had not returned. Finally he comes to the table, and we had decided to switch to a table across from us, because it was a little cleaner.  He comes over and we asked for menus, and 2 glasses of tea, another 20 minutes go by and still no menu or drinks.  I asked my husband if he was ready to leave, and low and behold the server shows up with the drinks, but no menu.  He asks if we are ready to order.  I laughed and said, "I would love to, but you have never brought the menus"....."Oh," he says...finally the menus show up, and we ordered Burgers with their fries.  We asked him to bring us a plate of fries as they are refillable, and when they get to the table....wait for it...they are cold.  Then the burgers get there, and he has given me the wrong bun.  LOL...I was afraid to say anything for fear the food would be taken and I would never see it again.  So, finally we ask for our check.  He comes to the table, and we give him  our loyalty card, he comes back, hands us the bill, we give him our credit card...oh, the bill did not come attached to the folio, so, he puts the credit card in his back pocket and goes over to another table to get their order.  I got up and went to the manager.....The whole experience was less then stellar and I do not think I want to go back to the Fairlakes store for awhile.  The experience was not all that, for sure...!!

Been coming here for over 15 years.  They are open while under major reconstruction, which is a bad idea.  Who wants to have a dining experience in a war-zone?  There are sheets of wood on the floor, as the floors are ripped up.  All the art work is off the walls and what remains are hundreds of holes in the walls where the art was hung.  There are partially plastered walls, booths upholstered in the existing fabric and what I would assume is the "new" fabric on only one booth so far.  There are tiles missing from the ceiling, most of the lighting it gone.  There are holes in the ceiling where light cans should be and hanging wires, it's a mess. While I applaud them for their industry in trying to stay open during renovation, I eat out very seldom and when I do I want the ambience as well as a decent meal.  My food was fine, though I didn't get what I ordered, but my friend found the grilled chicken in her salad to taste boiled and reheated on a grill and didn't eat her meal.  We also waited quite awhile to get our food.  That may be due to the renovation limitations.  Hope the new and improved is worth coming back to.

I love Red Robin and have been going for years, 22 years to be exact...tonight was not my best experience with the chain.  The Manager must have been off tonight as the dinner service was less than desirable.  This review earns three stars because the food was better than expected but the cleanliness and food timing was very poor!  To start the bathrooms were very dirty, no one was bussing tables and the food took about 35 - 40 minutes to get to the table after we ordered (the restaurant was not packed, several tables were open...approx 6:00 pm on a Sunday).  Additionally, the floors were dirty and looked like they hadn't been mopped in a couple of days.  We almost walked out, but the kids were hungry so we stayed. Our waitress, Christy, was awesome and kept our drinks full and kept telling us she was sorry for the long wait on the food.  As mentioned earlier, once we got our food it was first rate, but the wait was a lot longer than we have experienced in the past.  Bottom line, our experience would have been better if the manager/shift leader would have had cleanliness at the top of the list before opening the doors for business today and had kept on top of the cook staff to get food out of the kitchen faster.
Sat at the bar. Very friendly BK (Joshua) , great burgers and bottomless fries. But back end staff took way too long to bring the food.

Let's be frank. When it comes to Red Robin, I'm really biased. Because I'm in love.  I swear, they must put something in that red relish, because I would drive to the ends of the earth for a burger with that magical condiment. Also, bottomless root beer floats are at the same time the best and worst idea ever. And this last trip, my boyfriend got a pumpkin pie milkshake {because he will and must have everything pumpkin}. I'm not a fan of pumpkin pie, just too much of something {pumpkin, most likely} for my liking, but I tried this milkshake. And holy crap, it tasted about as close to the real thing as a milkshake can get. And I was all at once impressed and disgusted {no offense, Red Robin, no offense}.

Cocktails are over saturated with sugar and not consistent in taste.  The appetizers and entrees did not taste freshly created (i.e., frozen food) and was not appealing.  The food we had was either way too salty or just bland.  Nothing really original.  While not very crowded, we experienced slow service during our visit.  What a shame.  Two palms down.

Not only is this my favorite burger place but the service is unbelievable! Everyone is so friendly and they make sure you get exactly what you want. They're all so friendly and personable and put forth extra effort. Josh at the bar is the best, he always remembers my exact order and is just an all around delight to be served by. I highly recommend this to any burger lover. Great environment as we. Be sure to try the freckles lemonade!
This was our second visit to Red Robin.  Their burgers and fries are just incredible.  Our server, Ryan, was friendly and enthusiastic.  We followed his recommendations and were completely satisfied.

Burgers are decent and cheap, alcohol is a bit overpriced, but they do have an awesome selection of vegetarian and non-beef sandwiches and burgers which is really good for those trying to stay away from red meat or meat in general.  My biggest issue is probably more of an issue with myself, in that there are always tons of children around being super loud and annoying. I realize this establishment caters to children and families with children, but nonetheless be warned that this is not a super great place to go with just your significant other for a burger and beer, nor would I recommend it for watching sports, the atmosphere is just not conducive at all.

How I heard of this place: My first taste of Red Robin was when it opened in Bellingham, Washington while I was in junior high school. This particular one was introduced to me by my husband, Chris, when he had a burger craving on our day out running errands. Type of cuisine: Burgers and fries to start...Now patrons can also enjoy wraps, salads, sandwiches, mac'n cheese, prime rib dips, nachos and even pasta! Ambiance: Bright, cluttered and full of random artwork, from photographs of James Dean to cats, the Red Robin mascot, to Nagel prints. Booths and table-chair seating are available for diners wishing to enjoy their meals. The space is loud with music, children and the bustling of the diners. Serving staff is friendly, bubbly and very customer-service friendly.   What I ordered: To start, our long-awaited monster-sized Mint Brownie Shake ($4.49), of cool mint syrup and chewy Nestlé® Toll House® brownie pieces, topped off with whipped cream and more Nestlé® Toll House® brownie pieces. Knowing how I always get my free refill on bottomless fries, we requested ours before the burgers arrived in order that we could begin munching and not have to order an appetizer. For our main entrees, I selected the California Chicken Sandwich ($9.79), a tender, juicy grilled chicken breast topped with Provolone cheese, zesty guacamole, applewood smoked bacon, tomatoes, lettuce, pickles & mayo. A side of ranch dressing for my fries, and I was all set. Chris chose the Whiskey River BBQ Chicken Sandwich ($9.99), a tender, juicy grilled chicken breast basted with Red Robin's signature Whiskey River® BBQ Sauce and topped with melted Cheddar cheese, crispy onion straws, lettuce, tomatoes and mayo. A side of honey mustard dressing, and Chris was also ready to dig in! On a return visit, Sunday, February 19, 2012: Chris and I returned to this location on our way home from his birthday weekend in Lexington, Virginia, to partake of his free birthday burger. On this burger evening, Chris enjoyed the Prime Chophouse Burger ($9.69), "distinguished and delicious, this juicy burger is layered with horseradish-sautéed mushrooms, gourmet steak sauce, Provolone cheese and piled high with crispy onion straws. Served on an onion bun with creamy Country Dijon Sauce." For me, it was a tough call between burgers, the croissant BLT and the Whiskey River BBQ Wrap. Then, when I narrowed it down to having something hot, my staple Honey Mustard Chicken Burger seemed too been there done that, and I went with the Burnin' Love Burger ($9.59), "You'll get fired up for the crisply fried jalapeño coins, tangy salsa and spicy Pepper-Jack cheese layered on top of our cayenne-seasoned burger. It's topped with lettuce and fresh tomatoes to cool things off and served on a jalapeño-cornmeal kaiser roll with chipotle mayo." With a side of lemonade (that, I just noticed, was free!) for Chris and two additional baskets of bottomless fries with ranch dressing, our bellies were full and our faces happy! What I loved: I love the endless fries! Between the two burgers, the Whiskey River had more flavor and zip. The freshness of the California was noticeable in the vegetables and guacamole, but after having tried the BBQ sandwich, first, it left something to be desired. Why I loved it: Quick, simple, consistent and free for your birthday! I guess we will be back next month to celebrate! Cost: Average ($8-$10 per burger with bottomless fries)

I've been to Red Robin 5 times within the last 2-3 weeks and they've yet to disappoint me. Plus with a $20 reward on the way, I doubt I'd be disappointed anytime soon. Their bottomless drinks and fries are served within minutes of finishing the first serving. Just enough time to make room for more. Their burgers are as good as they get: hot and fresh! They only downside is probably the wait time which I thought was a bit too long but their food is worth the wait for me at least.

Good burger, good atmosphere, good service (most of the time). My personal favorite is the Whisky River BBQ Burger. I also tried the Royal Red Robin burger for the first time last week, it was really good as well. I'll sure try other burgers as they all look very good.

I went to eat here twice in the past few months. The first time was much better than the second time. However the first time when I ordered my burger medium-well it came out looking more like medium rare.  The burger and fries were EXTREMELY salty--and I love salt---but this was an excessive amount of salt!!! Their "bottomless fries" pitch annoyed me---because they advertise "bottomless fries" which seems like a good thing at first to those who love french fries--but they bring out a plate with a very small amount of french fries that are placed in a little circular metal thing that looks like a napkin ring. When you go to lift the napkin ring off your 5 or 6 french fries "wahlahhh! Bottomless fries! Get it?! The fries fall through the napkin ring and therefore there is no BOTTOM to them = BOTTOMLESS FRIES!!!" I wanted to punch the jerk who came up with that smartass idea.  The second time I went I ordered my burger well-done but the burger was so greasy that the grease saturated the bun and I could barely eat it because I was so busy trying to peel off the greasy spots that my burger fell apart. I asked for a basket of fries as to avoid having to ask for more fries because their bottomless fry advertisement is a sham, as I mentioned above and what did I get? The same small amount of fries in a basket thats very shallow to give the appearance that you're getting a lot more than you are! Wow. Both visits the fries were overcooked. I asked for fresh fries and by the time they brought them out I was ready to leave.   I put them and the rest of my burger in a to-go box that made my entire car smell like a noxious fart within 10 minutes. If the food in a box can make my car smell that bad within 10 minutes...I was scared to eat it so it went in the trash. Within hours my fingers were so swollen from all of the sodium in the food that I was in pain.
Terrible service - if you sit in the bar area , be prepared to wait long and send your order back. It's amazing the lack of coordination.

location: Falls Church City, Falls Church, VA
review: Family-catered restaurant with basic decor befitting a regular old burger place. But man are the burgers delicious! They can customize your burgers and even how well you want them to cook your burger. There are other places who do that as well but I feel they don't deliver and I always end up with overlooked meat that is either lacking in flavor or splattered in sauce. Love this place!

I have been coming to this Red Robin ever since it first opened and it's service, or lack there of, has gotten extremely terrible in the last 6 months. On numerous occasions we have had to wait more than 5-10 minutes to get our drinks and over 35 minutes to get our food (not ordering an appetizer). This last attempt has put us over the boiling point to considering returning to this location. We decided to sit at the bar as usual, since the service was generally OK in the past. We were greeted by Matt who has been part of the terrible service in the last 6 months. We put in an order for onion rings, a wrap, and a burger, no substitutions or special orders required. We were promptly given our drinks in 5 minutes and the onion rings came out within another 5. There couldn't have been more than 30% of the restaurant filled at this point so we thought the rest of the food would have come out within 15 mins of the appetizers. Boy were we wrong. Approximately 4 tables became full at the bar while we were eating our onion rings. This was at least 15 minutes after we had sat down and ordered. 20 minutes passes by and no food. 30 minutes pass by, still no food. No word from Matt explaining why everything is taking so long. Another group of 4 sit down in the bar area. Now two of the groups who sat down after us get their food...WTF. I keep seeing the manager peering out of the kitchen looking up at the bar. Another 10 minutes pass by, still no food and ANOTHER group who sat down at least 20 minutes after us has their food. OK seriously, 10 more minutes we are about to throw down $5 for our drinks. Matt comes by and says our food will be right out. 10 more minutes pass by. Don't tell us our food will be right out and 10 minutes later it's still not there. By now every group except for one has received their food before us. Finally our food comes out. No more than 2 minutes later does Matt drop off our check. What if we wanted another drink, what if we wanted dessert....are we not allowed? No one asks us how our meal is going, if we need anything else, or if we need anything else to drink. The other bar tender takes our check and luckily we could get out of there in 5 minutes. Never have I been so disappointed in a meal at this Red Robin in 20 years. Had the manager not disappeared I would have expressed how bad this place has gotten and to not expect our return business anytime soon.
My service was excellent! Josh was wonderful and made the best milkshake I think I've ever had. I had the guacamole burger and it was delicious. Can't wait to come back!

Made a mistake of ordering lunch to-go. They didn't even put plastic utensils or napkins in my bag, and didn't even give ketchup for the fries. The wrap practically was all apart when I brought it (I didn't shake it or anything, just brought it in my car to work) and I ended up eating a little with a fork, but then just put the whole thing in trash. Such incredible neglect to the meal. Needless to say, I will NEVER set my foot in this place again.

I went to Red Robin for the first time today to check out their veggie burgers. I should've known things were off to a bad start when I had to wait almost 5 minutes to be seated. There was only one table filled in the whole restaurant, so I am not sure what all the waitstaff was doing. My waiter was either not paying attention or brand-new. She brought me Sprite instead of club soda, then started arguing with me though the drink was clearly sweet. "Well, I must have accidentally put some Sprite in there." After suggesting the French onion soup in response to my request for a meatless soup, she then brought me the clam chowder. When I pointed out that I ordered the French onion, she started to argue with me. "Oh, did you decide you wanted French onion?" I had to remind her that she's the one that suggested it. Just terrible service. The French onion soup, when it finally arrived, was tasteless except for an over abundance of salt. The crouton was soggy. I didn't finish it. The waitstaff ran off after delivering my veggie burger without giving me a chance to ask for mustard, which is not kept on the table.  Then she didn't return for five minutes. The veggie burger was plain and tasteless. Elevation Burger has veggie and vegan burgers that taste much better for half the price. I see no reason to spend money on poor service with argumentative staff and mediocre food.  I will not be returning.

*SERVICE WAS 5 STARS* *Food was a 3.5* Four of us came for dinner and drinks on Thursday, the bar had just enough seats left for my group so we opted for that. Josh S. was our bartender- he was fantastic; really attentive, kind, and funny- he wins the 5 star for this review. This was a huge change from my last experience at the Chantilly location where we just weren't thrilled with anything from service to the food but this trip to Fair Lakes redeemed the name. He and another bartender were together for about 30 minutes of our visit, once the other guy left it was Josh running the bar, service bar, and running food to the bar area. My group didn't feel neglected or ignored even with all the extra work Josh S. had to do; he was really great- I plan to come back just to see him again!  About the food....it's good, bottomless fries are just fun in general, the burgers are huge and you definitely leave full; it's just not my first go to choice. I had a bacon cheeseburger, medium- it was cooked exactly how I like it. The chipotle mayo or whatever the pink sauce is was really awesome, as is the ranch; I'm not a fan of the honey mustard, however, which is sad because that's my go to condiment everywhere else.  Overall we had a really great time, can't to come back and sit at the bar with Josh!

Sure, it's not really what I think of when I think of "gourmet," but it certainly isn't bad! I've always had a soft spot for Red Robin and their baskets of bottomless fries (gotta top it with that crack-like seasoning), and this location is the definition of A-OK. They renovated this location recently, so it's got a new section with nice windows, a patio, and a chalkboard wall to entertain the kiddos while you're waiting for a table. Some of my favorites on the menu include the Royal Red Robin (cheeseburger with an egg), the Banzai (teriyaki and grilled pineapple), and the guacamole bacon burger (self-explanatory). I also really enjoy their prime dip sammy. My one tip is to skip the apps -- especially the o-rings, as tempting as even the "o-ring shorty" might be, because with bottomless fries you'll have more than your fair share of goodies to snack on. I usually ask for a basket of fries to start out with as a makeshift appetizer, in fact!

Great service by my good dude Joel from Flordia! Got everything I wanted on time and he was super nice and mannered.  The burgers was really good. Medium rare came out just perfect and the sauce they gave us was more than enough. Fries were just perfect and so was my Irish Beer Shake.  Everything was awesome!

This place has really gone down hill. Yes it's been remodeled but the food is low budget and poor quality. The service, if you can call it that, is piss poor. I won't be eating at this location again.

Nothing special about this place.  Took forever to get our food.  Bottomless fries were in a container so small we had to order another basket when the first basket arrived. Went through 5 baskets to get enough for two people. Burger was expensive and nowhere near gourmet.  Lots of better choices out there.  In fact, for what I got, Micky D's would have been better. Slow service, mediocre food and high price make this a very questionable place to go.

The evening started fine, then quickly went downhill. We ordered our drinks, appetizers, and entrees. My husband ordered a Smoke & Pepper burger with no lettuce or pickle, cooked medium. When it came out, it was well done with pickle and lettuce. He picked it off and we finished our meal. We had no napkins or silverware during our meal; we had to ask for napkins at the very end. I informed our server that I had a reward I wanted to use. He said ok and said he could take my card(since I had it ready) and process it to save us time. He then proceeded to disappear for 15-20 minutes. When we finally got the check, the card had not been run, and the reward had not been applied. I informed him of the reward, and reminded him I had given my card. He had to dig around to find my card, then went to run it again. About 5 minutes later, a woman brought the check and my card back over, but it was missing the slip for me to sign. We waited a few moments, and my husband went to track down any server he could find to ask him for our slip. That server told him that was the amount we owed, which is when my husband let him know we had already paid. They then found our slip, which we tipped and signed. The restaurant was not exceptionally busy, with many empty tables. There were other servers just sitting at the bar instead of working or trying to help. I'd much rather go somewhere pricier and get better service.

If I could give it zero stars I would. This restaurant was so dirty we left. There was food on the floor of every dining room. We were seated at a dirty booth and given sticky menus. Needless to say, we got up and left.

Decent food and horrible service. On a non-busy Sunday for a late lunch, restaurant greeter was MIA for a few minutes. After we were seated, another 5 minutes went by before our waiter even acknowledged us. Then he got a Sprite order wrong and bought over water instead for my son. There were no sugar on any tables and after requesting and waiting another 5 minutes for sugar for my iced tea, I ended up getting it myself. Another 10 minutes went by and finally got our food but there were no napkins or utensils given to us. Requested for napkins and waited another 5 minutes for service. Needless to say, I will not be going back to this Red Robin and probably all Red Robins in the future.
Very poor service. Slow, inexperienced wait staff and the food was just meh.  Will not return.

It's tough to find a nice thick juicy burger made with a toasty bun, topped with fresh shrooms and grilled onions!   But alas, we were driving by the ole institute of Red Robin and thought of their burgers! We sat at the bar for quick service and a fast cocktail.   Our server was quick to service and provided those bevvies as fast as we ordered!    The full menu was overwhelming, and my original craving for a big fat juicy burger was pushed aside when the appetizer menu flashed before my eyes!    My two favorite fried foods in the world are fried zukes and 'shrooms, both available in their 'Pick 2' for $7 option!   So that decision was made!   The hubby ordered a fat juicy burger with a bleu cheese and chipotle sauce.   That burger came with their 'never ending' fries!   My fried zukes and 'shrooms were flashed fried with a thick tempura type batter.  It was ridiculously greasy even with those fresh veggies.   They included some yummy sauces but those sauces could not disguise the grease on my veggies.   Not something I would order again.   The hubby enjoyed his massive burger but unfortunately, when they only include a few fries with the order, and the next 'AYCE' fries take another 10 minutes to arrive, it's not an enjoyable eating experience.  For almost $12, it would be nice to receive a larger batch of fries instead of waiting for the small plate to arrive every 10 minutes.

It's a known fact that I am a burger man!  I can eat all kinds of burgers anytime of the day.   I used to live near this Red Robin and I had never really eaten here.   We had a last minute stop in Fair Lakes so opted to have burgers. We sat at the bar since we were in somewhat of a rush.  The bartender was efficient in taking our drink and food orders.   Draft beer was priced right and I went outside of my comfort zone and ordered a 'gourmet' burger that included bleu cheese and some sort of chipotle mayo.   The burger was pretty hefty along with that hearty bun.    It was cooked to my satisfaction.   My only issue was the lack of fries on the platter.   Yes, it's an all you can eat french fry option but it's a tease when you have to keep requesting more fries.  There is at least a 5-10 min wait for those fries.  If you are a french fry munching fiend, you know that once that burger is done, then the fries are done too.     Burgers at this sit-down place fluctuate between the $10-$12 zone, so it would be nice to have my meal all in one sitting.
I took my kids there for dinner today. The food and the service was excellent. This is one of three Red Robins I've been to in the DC Metro area, but definitely the best. I highly recommend it.

I love burgers and garlic. The garlic fries here are awesome. The Red Robin Teriyaki Chicken Burger is so good!  When it comes to eating at dine-in burger restaurant Red Robin does a decent job. The one thing that upsets me is. No matter how heavy of a sweater I bring along with me to dine here. I'm still always cold here. I've dined in several sections in the past at this location, seems that I will always be in a forever search for the Artic free zone.

The food is good, but dang... The service is horrible & slow. My husband and I needed a refill before we even got our meal, and had to ask twice (we would've asked more, but we never saw our waiter). We didn't get our refill until we got our CHECK!!! Not a good experience at all. We will not be back!

I went to visit red robin in fair lakes to have a couple drinks and some food . ( I don't currently drive and my girlfriend is a host there ) so I was waiting for her to get off work and go home . Keep in mind I wasn't talking to her or disrupting her work atmosphere at all. I spent $30 and cut myself off and went to sit down on a cushion chair while I waited for my girlfriend to get off work (she was getting off in about 30 min) the manager named Nahum or something like that came up to me and said I need to spend money or leave . I told him my situation and that I wasn't disrupting her work , I've spent money , I'm listening to music for 30 minutes and the place isn't crowded at all. He said he was going to call the cops. I said F red robin out loud and the bar tender came up to me telling me I'm a "bitch" and he wants to "f me up" his name was Matt . Overall I've never been so disrespected at a restaurant in my life before . I also one time received a burger from my girlfriend when she bought it after her shift and brought it home for me . It wasn't Cooked properly and gave me food poisoning for about a week . I don't recommend ever eating or associating any business with this red robin. - Andre It's funny Nahum how you tell everyone you told me if I simply moved my position in The restaurant I could of stayed but in reality all you said was buy more stuff or leave. Still no apology . Still nothing . I guess you Can't expect much from nothing.

I'm done with Red Robin. In the last year or so this chain has taken a turn for the worse. I thought maybe I just caught them at a bad time, but no I don't think so. The last four visits, two to different locations, left me feeling very underwhelmed for my newly increased bill. The service was fine, but the food and the value was terrible. Each time I thought maybe that was a bad day..the next visit only re-affirmed that things are not good anymore. The burger patties seem to be marginally better than a frozen patty from Costco. I remember the day when my teeth sunk into a Royal Red Robin burger and I thought, damn this is good. Now I think, damn I got ripped off why did I come back here.

My girlfriend and I moved to the area a year ago and are regulars at this Fair Lakes location.  The team at this location is exceptional. They always cover each other when they're busy, and they have great deals if you are part of their mailing list.  We really enjoy the atmosphere in the bar (21 and over only).  As young adults with no children, there are not many places you can eat out at where few children will be present, much less none.  We'll continue to be regulars for years to come if they keep up their current mode of operation.
Fast and friendly serves. Had a great burger. The sweat potatoes fries are also great. The outdoor seeking it nice, weather permitting.

What horrible customer service. The guy managing the seating in the bar yelled at us twice... Even though we did exactly what the manager told us to do. Btw the manager was really nice and I don't blame her whatsoever. But by the time everything was sorted out I just wanted to leave. honestly that guy managing the seating in the bar should be fired. He was soooooooooooooo rude to us. I haven't experienced that before at a chain restaurant.

Less than impressed with this Red Robin. We normally go to the one in Chantilly and that has become one of our favorite spots.  We stopped here as it was more convenient during our shopping trip. The problems started right away. We walked in and it was not busy (it was around 3 pm on a Wednesday). We asked the host if we could sit in the bar. Instead of showing us to our table and handing us menus like we were used to, he pointed towards the bar area with his pen and ignored us. We had to ask our server for a menu.  Our server was very nice, but the food wasn't great. We had an order of fries to start. She brought two baskets and one of them was stone cold. My usual patty melt came with slightly burnt bread. I ordered coleslaw and it was swimming in so much mayo it was inedible.  Not a terrible experience, just not what we  were expecting.

Came here on Christmas Eve and it wasn't terribly busy so we got say right away. On each table, there's a really cool monitor that you're able to order apps, drinks, desserts and I think one other thing. Only thing you can't really order is your meal. You're also able to pay for your meal with a card through the monitor too. Our server, Audrey, was attentive and sweet but was literally running around - I felt bad for her. I got the freckled lemonade.. So good every time I love it.  We started off with the spinach dip... Eh. It wasn't too great, it didn't really have any taste to it. My dad and I split the chili cheeseburger and bruschetta chicken with sweet potato fries for both. Both were so delicious. The chili cheeseburger was surprisingly really good and not as messy as I thought it would be. The bruschetta chicken was sooo good too. I liked the pesto that comes on it. The sweet potato fries are delicious, I recommend getting them if you're "trying" to be healthier.  Overall, it was a good experience!

Do you not get a veggie burger here.  I ordered a plane fancy a burger with cheddar cheese today and was horrified when it came and I took a bite of it..  The bank came with some sort of tartar sauce, which I had not asked for.  The burger was mealy tasting and undercooked.  The cheese was only halfway melted.  The only thing that I was the broccoli which came as a side dish.  I would never suggest ordering a veggie burger from this establishment period.  I literally walked out of the restaurant in disgust, leaving my husband to pay the bill.

Joining the majority, or better, the average rating here: I used to love RR, but that was about 10 years ago (yes it's been that long since I last had it) and in a different state. Now, I think it is just OK. I would not go back if it weren't for the burgers, which are indeed, very good (and numerous -at least one for every taste). So burgers are good, onion rings are a little above average, but french fries are terrible (I don't care if they are bottomless, I rather them be good), almost stale and flavorless. The ambiance borders terrible as well -but we did go on a Saturday night, which means it was very busy, very warehouse-like, and annoyingly loud (we were sat in the central/main room, not sure if the other rooms, or the area by the windows were a little more cozy). Service was good but rushed from the server, and inattentive by the hosts.

I used to come to this location ALL the time. I've known a bartender here for years! I returned after maybe a year or two. Ordered the same thing I always order - chicken caesar wrap. I always get the unlimited fries. The wrap was disgusting. I think there were about 2 pieces of chicken and about a pound of lettuce. Needless to say, I didn't finish it. Then the "endless" fries, we got about 6 of them in our basket. What happened to filling the basket up? Funny thing is I went to the Red Robin in Leesburg a few months ago (I wrote a review about that one as well). And I kept telling the person I went with, it was something about the Leesburg location, Fairfax is so much better. After Friday, I decided I am done with Red Robin.

I love the huge variety of burgers and their drinks. That's my biggest take away. Their bottomless fries are great quality. The venue itself is very hospitable and fun to be in. If you want a different kind of burger than just your standard take check this place out.

Mediocre. The servers were a bit slow and apathetic. I had felt as if I were talking to a self check out machine. The food was great though fattening, however the servers need to step up the game as they significantly reduce the dining experience. When I eat out, I would prefer to eat for the food, however the service is about 45 percentage of the dining experience.

Red Robin went too fancy, they were fine the way they were.  But this location is heads and shoulders above the one in Chantilly by the Costco.  That one is terrible service.  The Fair Lakes location was good, the people were very nice and the food came out as expected.

Do NOT go to this Red Robin. TERRIBLE SERVICE! After we were seated, we sat for 20 mins without service. Three separate families came in after us and were serviced immediately. Waiters walked by us without asking if we have been helped. One waiter looked like he hated life in general. We complained to the on duty manager who didn't seem to care other than offering to re-seat us. We will NEVER go back to that Red Robin again. Save yourself the headache we went through and go to a different Red Robin.

Went here today with my kiddo (schools closed and we were running errands in the Fairlakes area). Came in right when they were opened, we were immediately seated and seconds later greeted by our waitress. First off, the waitress was absolutely delightful. She was so friendly and checked on us a lot. Food was brought out quickly and it was all tasty. I got the soup/sandwich combo and my son got the chicken tenders. Everything was hot, fresh and yummy.  My kid finished every bite, which he rarely does at restaurants. A happy kid = happy mommy. Will definitely be returning.

Come here if you have kids!! This place is my go to when I am craving a good meal meanwhile my child can get entertained. They have truly upgrades to touch screen device on each table. A mini tablet for families to order food and even pay their bill. The best part is that they have kid shows and kid games on their so you can actually enjoy an adult conversation at dinner with your toddler.  Food is great as always.  I wish they're kids menu was a bit more than the regular hot dog and spaghetti. It would be nice to see more of a variety for them. I love the strawberry lemonade!
Great service, seated immediately. Food came in a reasonable time, staff was attentive and courteous. Everything tasted delicious. I will be leaving the resturaunt tonight very happy and very full.

Despite the wait. It's worth waiting after all there is a reason they are always busy! They are the best in the area. We had a great time with our friends. The staff is nice and friendly the food goes with out saying. Love the new menu item and their drink and happy hour specials are pretty good. Definitely will be back soon.  Great experience as always. Thanks management team keep it up!

**My photos are from a previous visit.  I guess I forgot to review them at that time.** My husband and I stopped in on April 2nd at 8:45 pm for a late dinner.  Even though it was on the later side of the evening, we were sat quickly.  The restaurant was clean and service was good. We ordered a cheese burger, onion rings and and black and bleu burger with sweet potato fries. The onion rings were presented beautifully.  They were warm and crispy. The burgers were cooked perfectly and I loved the sweet potato fries. Robert was our server.
Great burgers and fries. Bar staff where I have eaten twice are responsive and friendly.

Yesterday was the worst experience I've ever had at a Red Robin. We ordered an appetizer and a drink that never made it to our table. The food was excellent at the time, but I got very sick from it last night.  Tom, our waiter, never came to check on us until we complained to someone else that we never got the things we had ordered and that we didn't want them anymore. He made a very half-hearted apology. A manager never stopped by to ask us about our experience either, even though we saw her walk by a few times and tried to get her attention.  We will not be going back to this Red Robin again!

It's a Red Robin. It's good but nothing totally special. The service was absolutely fantastic and the food was decent. 4 stars because the mac and cheese is a little bland and watery, and the bun for my burger was a little soggy.

meh... just another chain restaurant with servers who can care less about their jobs.  I went here and there was nothing extra.. we were sat in a secluded area of the restaurant and our service was okay she did everything she was forced to do but nothing sincere. She walked off as she was still talking to us.  Our food was good but dry. I do not get what is so special about their french fries besides them being bottomless. Overall there was nothing special that called out for me to go again. Just another local burger joint

Not a fan of the rude hostess....asked for a high chair and was told no because it's a fire hazard...I call BS....we were sitting in an area that was off to the side...guess we are not coming back since we have a kid that needs a high chair

I frequently dine at this Red Robin. The experience has gone from wonderful to miserable in the last 6 to 8 months. Although each server hasn't gone above and beyond to help themselves individually, I blame 100% of my poor experience on the manager. I think the perfect punishment would be for him/her to dine at this restaurant for themselves and find out what the experience is like from our perspective.  It has been common place for our wait once seated to be 10 plus minutes before a server comes to us. Each experience has had various errors in the order such as wrong and I'll-prepared food. I am currently dining at the restaurant right now and I haven't seen a manager since I arrived 40 minutes ago. Our waiter this experience is Alex he has done an above average job considering his manager isn't putting him in a winning position.  Wait, I just saw the manager. She was addressing the other angry patrons by telling them it is not her fault, but the fault of the brand new waitress. If I was a member of the corporate side of Red Robin I would fire her immediately for not running her restaurant with accountability and integrity.

We took 50 parents and children to the Fairlakes Red Robin on Saturday for lunch.  I called ahead about 30 minutes in advance and they were fully ready for us when we arrived.  The service and food was great.  Thank you Red Robin for a very positive experience.

So glad my husband and I decided to slip in here late last night for a quick dinner. I just expected plain old burgers and fries, but they have a French dip sandwich with the "best" prime rib and au jus. The chicken tortilla soup was filling and just the right size. My husband had the fried chicken "salad" and he said it was wonderful. It was so much food that we had to get "to go" boxes. The wait staff were very friendly and helpful. We will be going back to this location soon. Well worth the money!!!

Never had an opportunity to be served; as my son and I waiting for approximately 15 minutes without food or water in the sun room section of this subpar establishment. They had three (3) servers working this section and even after other patrons were seated they received service late but they received service. Needless to say, the resturant across the street called Guapa's was like a breath of fresh air on this 100° plus day. Cleaner and smiling faces

We came in early on a weekday for dinner right around 5:00. Wendell greeted us quickly and took a drink order without hesitation. He was patient with our questions as we were dining with an 8 year old with a particular palate. The food all came out hot and freshly prepared. We had onion rings to start and went different directions with dinner. The kiddo had meatballs on a stick, my best gal pal had a chicken wrap in a spinach tortilla and I ordered like a glutton and went for the Whisky River BBQ burger. We all had a great time and enjoyed talking to our server. I'll continue to be a loyal diner here. Great for kids.
We odered 2 drinks, we got 3 by mistake. All 3 sides were wrong.  One order was not made as ordered.  But the food itself was Good

We went to the location on a slow Sunday night, with a group of 10 people. We got to the location around 8:30 pm, almost 1.5 hours before closing. We experiences the worst service ever when it came to our food.  Our server kept refilling our Drinks and giving us fries but the burgers came close to 9:45. When the burgers came out they were cold as brick didn't look like they were grilled at all, looked like they were just microwaved and slapped on the bread. We had to send couple of them back as they were still partially frozen. This was not my first time eating at the location but the food was horrible! Just felt bad for the server as the kitchen staff did a horrible job!!
Typical red Robin burgers but we had the worst service ever. Order was wrong , took forever to take our order , didn't greet us, no refills

What a horrible experience. It has been a couple years since our last visit and thought to come here for lunch. We sat down and we saw there were little displays on the table, the waitress turned them on for the kids and got our orders. When the waitress brought the fries for my kids they looked dark brown, I tried one and it was sour... The oil tasted old but it wasn't just that, the waitress asked the kitchen and was told they double fried them by mistake. That's what they were giving children from the kids menu. Anyway when I got the check there were 2 charges for "Entertainment System"... I asked the waitress and she told me it was for the video games... What?!?!?!? You came to the table, setup the displays for my kids and "forgot" to mention there was a $4 charge? In response she claimed the kids authorized the sale...but I'll get you the manager. Manager comes and starts off with "I understand you don't want to pay for the video games, but you're playing with them, we removed one and kept the other one", I explained her that we weren't advised about the charges (which is by the way it really comes down to principal) and she said: you're playing with it aren't you?  She was just there arguing and arguing that because I let the waitress activate the display I should have known there was a charge... The food was bad, service was bad and management was horrible.

My wife vowed never to go back to Red Robin because of the horrible service. I liked their food so I had yet to make the same commitment. My wife was out of town Saturday September 10th so I decided to take my daughter there for dinner. It was odd because the place was only approximately 25% full. We were seated. We waited almost 25 minutes and no server had even acknowledge we were there. The exact reason my wife said she would never go back. I talked to the manager and he said that is why he was hired, to fix the problem. Well, it is not fixed and they have now lost another customer forever. I give 1 star because even though they have decent food, it does not matter if you do not have a chance to eat it. Oh, we went elsewhere that evening and had a pleasant evening.

So I usually dig Red Robin, they have a fun kids menus and great sweet potato fries. Also, they're doing a promotion where 1% of your check goes to a school registered on your loyalty card. Awesome, however, this particular RR seriously lacks in customer service. A couple of big parties came in and swamped them, and instead of saying to the rest of us, "sorry, we'll be right with you," they instead proceeded to ignore the fact that the lobby was filling up and people were just standing around waiting to even be acknowledged. It's not a deal breaker, but seriously, a little goes a long way in making someone's visit pleasant.

I just got back from this restaurant (on 9/27/16 around 9:00pm) after an impromptu date with my fiancé and let me start by saying I love this place! The servers are amazing and the food is always great. Today however I experienced something I didn't think I would. The hostess was by far one of the rudest individuals I have ever met. She looked incredibly unkept and acted as if certain patrons were a burden to her. As we stood in front of the hostess stand, waiting for her to return, she looked at us as if we were bothering her. She then said "what's up?" with the nastiest attitude as if we were crazy to ask her to . We then asked to be seated and she proceeded to roll her eyes. This infuriated my fiancé but I unknowingly gave her the benefit of the doubt.  While we were eating our dinner, my fiancé noticed the hostess constantly rolling her eyes at everyone who entered the restaurant asking to be seated. We saw her on her phone and ignoring individuals until one of her coworkers would walk by and at that point she was the most dutiful hostess. It did however strike me as odd that when an individual who appeared to be Caucasian entered the restaurant, they were greeted with the utmost respect while those of "darker hues" were treated with disrespect. After noticing all of this, against my fiancés guidance I took it upon myself to wish this hostess a great evening. Only to see her roll her eyes at me in disgust. This individual is either having a terrible day or there are some deep seeded issues where she does not need to be interacting with individuals. But I guess it's better than having her serve food and me ending up with spit or something else in it.

First time at this location.  I was greeted promptly and given a choice of where I could sit.  Sat near the bar and Josh the bartender was also my server.  He paced me properly (drink order, time to peruse menu, etc) and was very personable.  I ordered the Red Robin Royale: medium -cooked burger with bacon, fried egg, tomato on an onion roll.  Also had sweet potato fries.  Everything was excellent and my food came out quickly. I'd never had a burger with an egg topping but I'm a fan now.  If I'm ever in this area again I'll return to this Red Robin.

Uuuugh. I really wanted to like Red Robin here, but it's just not good. (I moved here from California, where Red Robin serves juicy flavorful burgers with stellar customer service.) We've gone 4-5 times in the last couple months, and it's worse each time we go.  The servers seem like it's their first time on the job of serving. Even if they are enthusiastic, they are inept. I really hate to say that, since I know how hard a server's job is.  The food is bland, boring, dry, and underwhelming.  My elementary-aged child even proclaimed that obviously the "bottomless fries" are not bottomless, since our plates sit empty with no visit from our server and no offer to refill them. Overall, despite many attempts to love this place, we are putting it behind us and will not go again.  Of additional note, this is not a good restaurant for allergy folks. Some in our family are allergic to gluten and dairy. Even though we've stated the allergy and ordered appropriately, our orders have been contaminated each time.

Good old Red Robin, Aka: the Dirty Bird. There was a time in college where I knew pretty much the entire wait staff here, and as such this particular restaurant will always have a special place in my heart. I have also learned the secret to curing a hangover is with one of their delicious crispy chicken sandwiches. mmmm. So good. It has seriously never failed me.  I don't eat here very often anymore, and both the staff and the decor have changed over the years, but I still love this place. The bar area is always laid back, has good service, and is fairly slow, so it's a good place to unwind with friends and catch a game.  They also have on table service tablets now (like Chilli's does) so you can order aps, play games and pay for you ticket there; easy-peasy.  The restaurant itself is always clean and constantly hosting kids events; baseball team meets, sorority/fraternity meetups, boy-scout groups, etc. They do a lot of business, but I haven't ever had bad service over the years. You gotta love a place like this, even if it is a national chain, they do it really well.

I have never had a bad experience at this location of Red Robin and my last visit on 10/20 was no exception.  The ambiance of this restaurant is similar to any other Red Robin you'll visit. It is styled with road side signs scattered throughout the restaurant, trying to recreate the feeling of a roadside diner.  Our service was excellent and I thought our waiter was very knowledgeable about the menu. He suggested one of the specials and how I could have a veggie patty instead of a regular burger.  The only reason I cannot give Red Robin a higher rating is as a  pescetarian their menu is somewhat limited.  In a nutshell, when I am in the mood for something casual but more fancy than heading to a McDonalds, Red Robin is a good choice.

I am never eating here ever again. They told me that they don't take reservations over the phone for party of 11 and told me to hold and while I'm on the phone they talk and say that we took a reservation for 30 people so they have to wait because we don't take reservations. Such a lying business. I took my group of friends celebrating my birthday down the road to TGI Friday. No matter the size of the group treat them like customers.

Wow congrats to this location for making me realize how bad red robin can and is. Also why I won't be in a rush to ever go back. Where do I start?!? Hmmmmm.... Waiter-  if anyone sees him let me know! There was a guy wearing hipster glasses that took the order. He might have been the guy who promised my daughter more juice but never returned. He certainly wasn't the lady I had to get to take my check so I could leave. PS crappy service and a broken tablet thing that wouldn't let me tip isn't going to pay your bills.
