Luckily I served before or I would have  paid and walked out without adding the tip.  Food - got the ghost burger that should have been called the jalapeño and bread. I think it said there are two pieces of meat or you can upgrade to a large single. I must have downgraded accidentally because I got a single paper thin.. Fries are ok and thanks to the seasoning you can put on them they are good! Second order of fries were clearly rushed and either undercooked or under cooked. My fiance liked her burger so I gave an extra star since she was happy.  Tip- the table top tablet will charge you if you play "premium" games. The kids managed to pull that off without me knowing. Not the end of the world just be careful

3.5/5. This is a pretty standard Red Robin. Obviously they specialize in burgers but have a fairly wide menu. One of their hooks is free refills on fries but this can be problematic as the servers are sometimes reluctant to get you refills. This location is better than some I've visited though. The service has generally been good to great when it comes to service. The worst service we've had here has been pretty good. If you're looking for a good burger place in the area this is a good option.
Service is friendly and the place seems to be run well, but too many times been dissatisfied with the food.

Came here to today for their black and blue burger ... yummy! The burgers were cooked perfectly and the bottomless fries were delicious. Our server, Audrey was attentive, efficient, and on point with delivery of food.

I so wish I could rate RR higher. I've been a HUGE fan of RR for years and have dined at multiple locations throughout the country. I've been in the loyalty program for years too and literally love the burgers.  This location is also near and dear to my heart because I've had good friends work here over the years.  Unfortunately, the service and quality control has been a major upset for us the last several visits. I keep insisting on giving them another try but they keep disappointing. Redskins fans may be able to relate to this... I'm not sure what's wrong with this location but I really hope management takes corrective action to ensure that the young folks at the hostess stand and those serving tables have some basic training. Also, the kitchen makes a lot of errors because I've seen our server write down and repeat verbatim what we ordered but 20 minutes later something different comes out. We have had at least one issue  (bad service, missing food, wrong order) during each of the past six visits.  Maybe I'm the problem. I keep coming back.

Went this afternoon.  Sitting in the bar.  Took about 20 minutes for meals and both were wrong.  My husbands was to be a lettuce wrap came out on s bun.  Was sent back.   I am celiac and checked allergy menu.  If you check gluten fries is on it and say dedicated fryer.  However I also check wheat and fries not on the list.   Looks like they don't know gluten is from wheat.    My burger was barely warm and did not come with avocado. As ordered. The mustard when opened had a huge glop of dried mustard totally disgusting.   Need to get there act together.  Very disappointed this time

Well, I think it is time that they remove the gourmet  from the title. I used to love this place, but they lost the high quality that they had awhile ago. I was just to stubborn to admit it. Can I please get some fries? Please? Bottomless steak fries now come by the pair. I don't think an order can contain less fries, take longer, or be any colder.  Mandarin  oranges for the kids , please more than 3 at a time. I spent the whole hour flagging down the waiter, who was about as slow as can be for a Sunday night with only 3 customers. He didn't know the happy hour menu and ... ahh, you get the idea, don't come her unless you want overpriced, underwhelming hamburgers and bottomed fries. It should be one star, but I still like the now smallish onion ring tower.

With the bottomless fries (and less publicized bottomless kids menu options (for some, not all, of the kids' meals)) and good eats on the cheap, this is one of my family's favorite places. Service is always wonderful, and even on busy night, food comes up quickly. The menu is limited, but a place that hails itself as serving gourmet burgers is being honest about its selections. Yet there's more options than you might think.

First off, bottomless French Fries is my driving reason why I enjoy visiting any Red Robbin location period.  My wife and I haven't dined at a Red Robbin since leaving San Diego in 2012.  This location features the self order terminals and of course my son who is three years old loves to touch everything with a flat screen; so please watch out you don't have any additional charges with the many games loaded on the system. Great distraction, but I personally don't care for them. I understand we are moving towards advancing our society with technology and hiring less people to make a profit. In doing so I felt the service was not accommodating for our Thursday night visit.  Sole reason why I visit is the Fries. I love their thick cut Fries; reminds me of English fish and chips Fries. Today, our fries where served room temperature and in my opinion stale from sitting under the heating lamp. With three attempts and specifically mentioning our distaste to our server, I felt it wasn't going to get better. Service was sluggish even with a handful of costumers in the dining room.  Due to the burgers saving the night and where surprisingly tasty, the night wasn't wasted. My wife enjoyed the Smoke & Pepper burger and I had the Marco Pollo Chicken Burger both prepared to how we ordered them... Will return to get my Fries how I liked them served!

We stopped in this place looking for something cool to drink on the first hot day of summer. Much to our surprise they had MILKSHAKES!! I ordered the Salted Caramel and my wife ordered the Mint Chocolate with Oreos cookies and both were delicious. In hindsight it would have been great to take a picture but of course neither lasted long enough for a quick photo session. If you are looking for a nice place to get a quick snack on a sunny afternoon this would be a good place to do it.

Food: 5/5 Service: 5/5 (Fairoaks) Red Robin is underrated! This place is good for birthdays (kids and adults), affordably priced, and accommodates to large parties. They have a great loyalty program, to boot! (K, I try to minimize the amount of coupon/ loyalty spam email, but I admit to actually looking at each email from RR ..lol). They give you a free burger for your birthday (YAY!) and offer really good coupons frequently.  As for food- I mean, 2 words: bottomless fries. Everything is good here, but my personal favorite is their California chicken sandwich. Also, Fairoaks has awesome service.

Always get the same thing here and throughout all the chains I've been to nationwide, I've got to say this one is the absolute worst. Had it not been for my boys, I would have left two minutes into coming here. Rude server, sticky table, funk on the seat, and a weird "wet rag" smell. I'll drive the extra distance to go to a different one from here on out. This is the last chance I've given this place. Absolutely horrid. I shouldn't have come here. I knew I shouldn't have. Ordered for the boys and myself. Bottomless fries came out first and I had to ask if it was a partial portion or the full one to which she said it was. There were maybe 10 fries on them. I then ordered my burnin love burger; something I get quite frequently. It came out with my kids' food except the hottest thing on it was the broccoli. The burger itself along with it's withered bun? Cold. I ordered it with some pink and there was no way in heck I was putting cold, slightly pink hamburger meat into my face. It's bad when one needs to then check their kids' food to ensure theirs was cooked... I do have to give it to the manager for coming back swiftly to see if they could give me another one but at that point, I was already over it.

My husband and I came here for lunch and had a nice meal. I had the Royal Burger and he had the Southern Charm Burger. Both burgers were excellent. For our appetizer we had the boneless chicken wings which were absolutely perfect. Our server's name was Tom and he was great! He showed us how to check out with the little touch screen at our table and was very attentive throughout our meal. Great food, location, and service!

We had such a good time even though I fought & fought the group/ kid decision to come. It's a lot better than I remember it.  We had a great waitress. She was on the ball. Checked in us every 12 mins or so. Our orders came out in a flash.  Kid choices are rather epic & also super affordable & not obscenely unhealthy. I got my kids to eat broccoli! Wasn't even doused in butter, cheese ir salted. It was just blanched perfectly & totally delicious.  The only bummer was that my burger kinda sucked. It had some terrible sweet relish smothered all over it & I just didn't dig it. The sweet potato fries though - oh my oh me. I wanted to politely ask the kind waitress for a bucket of them. But I refrained cause my arteries would not have approved.  Anyways - Here are the keys to success here:  1) don't go @ peak hours. The quality of ur experience declines greatly.  2) get those dang fries.  3) make sure u understand about the condiments on the food.

The restaurant was utterly disgusting. There was a drink spilled all over the floor and we told the staff about it. It took them FIFTEEN MINUTES to clean it up. The menus were stained with ketchup and grease. We sat at our table for 10 minutes waiting for someone to take our order. The food was mediocre. Not coming back here again...

Once this was my favorite restaurant.  In my teens, 20's and even the beginning of my 30's. I'd come here after high school,  I have been coming here for almost 20 years. Now having that said, recently we have had a few problems here and there (one no drink, no fry refills for my at the time girlfriend) which was taken care of. Another time where the server didn't want to be there and another wasn't attentive.  Those things happen.  We had some servers in between that were just amazing.  Now to my problem.  My dad and I went to get food and we were craving Red Robin. We went and we were greeted prosmptly, but that is all the attention we got. The waiters never paid any attention to us. We waited half an hour. Everyone was helped but us. We left and my dad told the people up front he had never been more offended at a restaurant and asked for a manager... they turned their back to him. After I found this out, I emailed corporate. All they said was they would talk to them. I wasn't asking for free food or anything... just to talk to a representative.   I was ignored in the restaurant and in the corporate level. I will update this if I go back...

Showed up to this location and although it was busy, my boyfriend and I were seated right away. Our waitress, Hannah C., was so friendly and we didn't have to wait any time at all for our drinks, to have our orders taken or even to receive some bottomless fries before our meals came.Twice throughout our meal we were checked on by a man who I believe was the manager and he was extremely friendly. Not only was the service great, but the food was so delicious as well. I had gotten the Royal Red Burger with fries and a chocolate milkshake and my boyfriend had gotten the Whiskey River BBQ burger and a Stella. We will definitely be coming back!

A rare occurrence happened to us this past Sunday, July 23, 2017. On this date in history something very rare happened. It only happens once or twice a year. In recent memory it has only occurred for us in the last year or so at Mike's American Grill in Springfield Virginia, at Nazca Mochica in Washington D.C. And Pio Pio in Hell's Kitchen, Manhattan New York City. It was an official "Ultimate Dining Experience." Of all places it was a chain restaurant and a burger joint. Red Robin in Fair Lakes.  Everything fell into place. We had gone to an antique show and were a little hungry. My wife had talked about going to Red Robin. We hadn't been to one in well over a year. The last one being in Manassas. Since moving to Springfield we hadn't been. We looked up Red Robin and decided to try the one out in Fair Lakes.  As soon as we walked in we were nicely greeted and seated. We decided to eat in the bar area. The place was very clean. I love clean, clean is wonderful. It was right after the lunch hour so being clean at this point means something. The place is set up nicely too. There is separation from the main dining area and the bar area to minimize the noise coming from the bar. I like high chairs. Not baby high chairs of course but high tables and tall chairs, they even have tall comfortable booth type tall seat and this is where we plopped ourselves down.  Immediately we were given menus and asked if we wanted drinks. For me of course a nice tall draft Bud Light and my wife some kinda strawberry lemonade type drink with Vodka. The beer was chill at just the right temperature and my wife loved the drink enough to as the waiter to let the bartender know. He can out and thanked us and talked to us a little. I wish we had his name. My wife tried another drink and again "perfect." Our order was taken by the bartender, he made sure he knew what we wanted and then we enjoyed our drinks while waiting.  Our food came out pretty quickly, the food was brought out by yet another super nice and friendly employee. Everything was perfect, buns super fresh, the lettuce, tomato and mushrooms all fresh and tasty. Both out burgers were cooked just as we asked and were juicy and packed full of flavor, the fries crisp and yummy. We were constantly checked in to make sure all was well. Very nice work. The meal prices are very reasonable too!! What's better than that? The place was fun, the great moods and friendliness of the staff made us feel good and bettered our mood, the atmosphere, cleanliness and wonderful food and drinks added to the whole experience.  This was an "Ultimate Dining Experience." and that my Yelp friends doesn't happen a lot or enough. We hadn't been to Red Robin in a long while but, I can tell you our visits will be a lot more frequent now. I never thought a burger joint could be so good. Hats off the the great crew we had the pleasure of meeting that day. Thank you for a job well done.

Ehhh it's okay.  For me, it's just overpriced for what you get. The food is okay and it is just average. Service is pretty good. I don't have really much to say. The only major downside is all the upcharges!! I went with a friend and we got pretzel bites with cheese and they didn't give very much cheese! We asked to have more and they were going to upcharge that!? It would have been an extra 2$! That was insane!!!  I think that was the main problem with this place. I think the food is just average but they charge a lot. The soup bowl is so tiny but it's so expensive!! I don't think I'd go back, maybe for a milkshake, but that's about it.  I also hate the way to pay. It is so tacky to have it on a tablet. To split the check is somewhat cumbersome as well. I wish you could just pay normally!!  Service is just average. Both times I went, it was nothing special. All in all, not memorable and overpriced!

Last night, I had a decidedly average experience at Red Robin, a change from what I am used to.  First, I do not know why we had two servers, not assistants or managers, but servers, and my order was wrong.  I just ate the burger and skipped the bun and topping vegetables as the roll was supposed to be plain, but was slathered in sauce, despite me telling one of the servers that I have a dairy allergy and wanted it plain.  I never got a fry refill that was requested, one that would not have had to have been requested if I had gotten a normal amount of fries with my dinner.  It also took forever to get a refill on a kid's mac and cheese. What was really disappointing is that the child's friend with whom we were dining recently had a birthday and I mentioned to the host that fact quietly as we walked to the table.  I was hoping that some of the surprise clapping was for her, but it was for two other tables, and we never got our birthday surprise.  It was a shame, but she did not know that I had told the host that, and there was no way for me to speak to them.  If they had surprised her, they would have had a customer for life as she had never been to a Red Robin previously. The wait staff was also slow in coming, but I think they rely on the tablets to be paged, something that you will not be able to do at a table where children are playing on it.  Speaking of the tablet, why is there a $2 fee when I felt overcharged as it was for a party of three, one adult and two children, with a bill of about $50 without any alcohol.  That and the lack of customer care was disappointing, even more so because Red Robin is generally not like that.   Compared to the Dulles and Chantilly locations that I have frequented recently, this one, which is the one that used to be our preferred location, has fallen short.  I felt like I was dining at a fast food restaurant, not fast casual, and the host and wait staff let me down when I thought they'd surprise the birthday girl with a song as they did to two other tables while we were there.   I do not think I'm going to rush back to any Red Robin as a result of last night's experience, since it was decidedly average for a casual/family restaurant experience, and sub-par for a Red Robin.

Unfortunately this restaurant hasn't shown improvement.  It is dirty and food service is extremely slow.  We frequent the Chantilly restaurant that I always rate excellent.  This may be the 3rd and last time we are returning.

Much improved since my first visit.  We sat in the bar area, which I like as it is usually a kid-free zone.  Sadly, there were two kids maybe 3 and 5 screeching. Our server, KP, was excellent.  Our food was taking quite some time and he stopped by with fries and an apology, noting that he was working on getting it out.  We really appreciated this--I hate when it doesn't seem the server cares/communicates when things are coming late--especially when the restaurant does not appear busy. The wedgie burger (comes with guac and a lettuce bun) is amazing and definitely worth a try with grilled chicken!

I was craving a burger so I came here. But it was such a disappointment. I ordered a burger but it was nothing like the picture. Also I don't consider it as a burger when they don't even use burger buns but some type of bread instead for the Madlove burger. Wish they had tell me beforehand. The fries they gave me were also slightly cold. My friend order the double tavern and it was really bad too. It looked like a burger at Burger King. And the picture has double patties but it only came with 1.  Wait time for the food as also extremely long. We waited for like 40 minutes.

Stopped by for my birthday burger.  Service was awesome compared to the Seven Corners Fall Church location (which I plan to never visit again).  Order for my A1 burger went through without any issues and was ready on time when I arrived.  The server went above and beyond by giving me a small cup of hot fries next to my order.  Food was hot and service was great.  Better than expected!  Two thumbs up guys!

For years, Jeff has said that he wanted to go to Red Robin because he had never been and I finally agreed to it! We went for dinner on a Monday and we beat the dinner rush for sure. I think we even had the waiter to ourselves for a bit! Btw, shout out to Tim for providing us with excellent customer service! I jokingly told him that he would have to impress Jeff because he had never been and he definitely delivered. He even brought us an extra sauce because he wanted us to be able to taste them all!  Anyways, we were seated at a booth in the bar section and it was nice! I enjoyed the decor a lot and there were a bunch of tv's playing football.  We ordered bottomless steak and sweet potato fries while we tried to figure out what we wanted to order - side note, don't do this, especially if you take forever to decide things because by the time our food came out, I was basically full. But the fries were AMAZING and I loved all of the different sauces. The BBQ and ranch based sauce was definitely my favorite. Tim said that that was the sauce for the onion rings but it tastes amazing with everything - he was right! I wasn't super impressed with the Thai chili sauce, which has an upcharge. I don't think it's worth it. I ordered a sangria and Jeff ordered a beer. They had a pretty decent beer selection. I really enjoyed the sangria! And it was only $5!  I ended up ordering the Citrus Harrisa Salmon Burger and Jeff got the Prime Chophouse Burger. It was disappointing to hear that they wouldn't cook burgers medium rare, but whatever. I feel like the food took a little while to come out, but when it did, it looked great! I honestly wasn't super impressed with the salmon burger and would probably not recommend it as being worth trying, but it was fine. Jeff said he enjoyed his burger and would recommend it, but probably try something new next time. Overall, we had awesome service and a good time. My one random complaint was the location. This shopping center is like a maze if you don't know where you're going and there's so many random separate parking lots for everything. Just kind of strange, but plenty of parking!

This place is kid friendly! At Red Robin - It's all about the french fries.  ALL YOU CAN EAT FRENCH FRIES! --And they're really good-- But, bottomless french fries can sometimes be a problem - mainly with hyenas, beagles and... my kids - who don't seem to have the common sense to stop eating when they're full. Our server was put through a 45 minute marathon bringing plate after plate. The kids even started running back to the kitchen looking for more when the servers didn't bring a new plate fast enough.  They ate most of the fries, but not all of them.  I looked under the table and found what they didn't eat. It looked like old play-dough.  I was truly embarrassed and ready to clean it up myself.
